intro: Bothriocline carrissoi, commonly known as the Mexican daisy, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other similar plants. The plant features showy yellow flowers with white ray florets, typically blooming in the spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in various regions beyond its native habitat.
